Uses of Class
java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask

  • Packages that use ForkJoinTask 
    Package Description
    java.util.concurrent
    Utility classes commonly useful in concurrent programming.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.currentJoin
      The task currently being joined, set only when actively trying to help other stealers in helpJoinTask.
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.currentSteal
      The task most recently stolen from another worker (or submission queue).

      The work-stealing queue array.

      Methods in java.util.concurrent with type parameters of type ForkJoinTask 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T extends ForkJoinTask<?>> 
      Collection<T>      		 ForkJoinTask.invokeAll(Collection<T> tasks)
      Forks all tasks in the specified collection, returning when isDone holds for each task or an (unchecked) exception is encountered, in which case the exception is rethrown.
      Methods in java.util.concurrent that return ForkJoinTask 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> ForkJoinTask<T> ForkJoinTask.adapt(Callable<? extends T> callable)
      Returns a new ForkJoinTask that performs the call method of the given Callable as its action, and returns its result upon join(), translating any checked exceptions encountered into RuntimeException.
      static ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinTask.adapt(Runnable runnable)
      Returns a new ForkJoinTask that performs the run method of the given Runnable as its action, and returns a null result upon join().
      static <T> ForkJoinTask<T> ForkJoinTask.adapt(Runnable runnable, T result)
      Returns a new ForkJoinTask that performs the run method of the given Runnable as its action, and returns the given result upon join().
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.deqTask()
      Tries to take a task from the base of the queue, failing if empty or contended.
      ForkJoinTask<V> ForkJoinTask.fork()
      Arranges to asynchronously execute this task.
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.locallyDeqTask()
      Tries to take a task from the base of own queue.
      protected static ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinTask.peekNextLocalTask()
      Returns, but does not unschedule or execute, a task queued by the current thread but not yet executed, if one is immediately available.
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.peekTask()
      Returns next task, or null if empty or contended.
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.pollLocalTask()
      Gets and removes a local task.
      protected static ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinTask.pollNextLocalTask()
      Unschedules and returns, without executing, the next task queued by the current thread but not yet executed.
      protected ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinPool.pollSubmission()
      Removes and returns the next unexecuted submission if one is available.
      (package private) ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.pollTask()
      Gets and removes a local or stolen task.
      protected static ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinTask.pollTask()
      Unschedules and returns, without executing, the next task queued by the current thread but not yet executed, if one is available, or if not available, a task that was forked by some other thread, if available.
      private ForkJoinTask<?> ForkJoinWorkerThread.popTask()
      Returns a popped task, or null if empty.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void ForkJoinPool.addSubmission(ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Enqueues the given task in the submissionQueue.
      private static boolean ForkJoinWorkerThread.casSlotNull(ForkJoinTask<?>[] q, int i, ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      CASes slot i of array q from t to null.

      CASes slot i of array q from t to null.
      (package private) void ForkJoinWorkerThread.execTask(ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Runs the given task, plus any local tasks until queue is empty
      void ForkJoinPool.execute(ForkJoinTask<?> task)
      Arranges for (asynchronous) execution of the given task.
      private <T> void ForkJoinPool.forkOrSubmit(ForkJoinTask<T> task)
      Unless terminating, forks task if within an ongoing FJ computation in the current pool, else submits as external task.
      private boolean ForkJoinWorkerThread.helpJoinTask(ForkJoinTask<?> joinMe)
      Tries to locate and execute tasks for a stealer of the given task, or in turn one of its stealers, Traces currentSteal->currentJoin links looking for a thread working on a descendant of the given task and with a non-empty queue to steal back and execute tasks from.
      <T> T ForkJoinPool.invoke(ForkJoinTask<T> task)
      Performs the given task, returning its result upon completion.
      static void ForkJoinTask.invokeAll(ForkJoinTask<?>... tasks)
      Forks the given tasks, returning when isDone holds for each task or an (unchecked) exception is encountered, in which case the exception is rethrown.
      static void ForkJoinTask.invokeAll(ForkJoinTask<?> t1, ForkJoinTask<?> t2)
      Forks the given tasks, returning when isDone holds for each task or an (unchecked) exception is encountered, in which case the exception is rethrown.
      static void ForkJoinTask.invokeAll(ForkJoinTask<?> t1, ForkJoinTask<?> t2)
      Forks the given tasks, returning when isDone holds for each task or an (unchecked) exception is encountered, in which case the exception is rethrown.
      (package private) int ForkJoinWorkerThread.joinTask(ForkJoinTask<?> joinMe)
      Possibly runs some tasks and/or blocks, until joinMe is done.
      private boolean ForkJoinWorkerThread.localHelpJoinTask(ForkJoinTask<?> joinMe)
      If present, pops and executes the given task, or any other cancelled task
      (package private) void ForkJoinWorkerThread.pushTask(ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Pushes a task.
      <T> ForkJoinTask<T> ForkJoinPool.submit(ForkJoinTask<T> task)
      Submits a ForkJoinTask for execution.
      (package private) void ForkJoinPool.timedAwaitJoin(ForkJoinTask<?> joinMe, long nanos)
      Possibly blocks the given worker waiting for joinMe to complete or timeout
      (package private) void ForkJoinPool.tryAwaitJoin(ForkJoinTask<?> joinMe)
      Possibly blocks waiting for the given task to complete, or cancels the task if terminating.
      private int ForkJoinWorkerThread.tryDeqAndExec(ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Performs an uncommon case for joinTask: If task t is at base of some workers queue, steals and executes it.
      (package private) boolean ForkJoinWorkerThread.unpushTask(ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Specialized version of popTask to pop only if topmost element is the given task.
      private static void ForkJoinWorkerThread.writeSlot(ForkJoinTask<?>[] q, int i, ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Performs a volatile write of the given task at given slot of array q.
      private static void ForkJoinWorkerThread.writeSlot(ForkJoinTask<?>[] q, int i, ForkJoinTask<?> t)
      Performs a volatile write of the given task at given slot of array q.
      Method parameters in java.util.concurrent with type arguments of type ForkJoinTask 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) int ForkJoinWorkerThread.drainTasksTo(Collection<? super ForkJoinTask<?>> c)
      Drains tasks to given collection c.
      protected int ForkJoinPool.drainTasksTo(Collection<? super ForkJoinTask<?>> c)
      Removes all available unexecuted submitted and forked tasks from scheduling queues and adds them to the given collection, without altering their execution status.
